message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.SY, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of optimizing coding and scheduling decisions for layered data delivery, which is a common problem in networked systems. The use of prioritized random linear coding (PRLC) and simultaneous transmission of data blocks suggests a focus on information theory (cs.IT) and networking (cs.NI). The use of Markov decision processes (MDP) and reinforcement learning approaches suggests a focus on machine learning (cs.LG) and control systems (cs.SY). Finally, the mention of an illustrative example for scalable video transmission suggests a focus on multimedia (cs.MM).
